info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 21 at 10:27PM CDT until March 21 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Smith County in northeastern Texas... Southwestern Upshur County in northeastern Texas... West central Gregg County in northeastern Texas... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 1027 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Tyler, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Big Sandy around 1045 PM CDT. Liberty City around 1050 PM CDT. Gladewater around 1055 PM CDT. White Oak, Clarksville City and West Mountain around 1100 PM CDT. Longview and East Mountain around 1105 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Warren City, Union Grove, Pritchett and Winona. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
